data.enText: kill or cure
used to say that what you are going to do will either be very successful or fail completely
data.chText: 要么医好要么治死；不是成功便是失败；成败在此一举

data.enText: prevention is better than cure
an ounce of prevention is better than a pound of cure
it is better to stop sth bad from happening rather than try to deal with the problems after it has happened
data.chText: 预防优于补救；防患于未然是上策

tr: a medicine or therapy that cures disease or relieve pain
provide a cure for, make healthy again
example: The treatment cured the boy's acne
The quack pretended to heal patients but never managed to

tr: prepare by drying, salting, or chemical processing in order to preserve

example: the apricots cure in the sun

tr: make (substances) hard and improve their usability

data.enText: to make a person or an animal healthy again after an illness
data.chText: 治愈，治好（病人或动物）

data.enText: Will you be able to cure him, Doctor?
data.chText: 医生，你能把他治好吗？

data.enText: to make an illness go away
data.chText: 治好（疾病）

data.enText: TB is a serious illness, but it can be cured.
data.chText: 肺结核虽然是一种严重的疾病，但可治愈。

data.enText: to deal with a problem successfully
data.chText: 解决，了结（问题）

data.enText: I finally managed to cure the rattling noise in my car.
data.chText: 我最终设法解决了我汽车发出的格格响声。

data.enText: to stop sb from behaving in a particular way, especially a way that is bad or annoying
data.chText: 矫正，改正（某人的不良行为）

data.enText: to treat food or tobacco with smoke, salt, etc. in order to preserve it
data.chText: （用熏、腌等方法）加工贮藏（食物或烟草）

data.enText: kill or cure
used to say that what you are going to do will either be very successful or fail completely
data.chText: 要么医好要么治死；不是成功便是失败；成败在此一举

data.enText: a medicine or medical treatment that cures an illness
data.chText: 药；药物；疗法

data.enText: the search for a cure for cancer
data.chText: 对癌症治愈方法的研究

data.enText: There is no known cure but the illness can be treated.
data.chText: 这种病尚没有确切的治愈方法，但可以医治。

data.enText: the act of curing sb of an illness or the process of being cured
data.chText: 治疗；疗程

data.enText: Doctors cannot effect a cure if the disease has spread too far.
data.chText: 假如这种疾病已扩散得厉害，医生也无法妙手回春。

data.enText: The cure took six weeks.
data.chText: 此疗程花了六个星期。

data.enText: something that will solve a problem, improve a bad situation, etc.
data.chText: （解决问题、改善糟糕情况等的）措施，对策

data.enText: a cure for poverty
data.chText: 解决贫穷问题的措施

data.enText: prevention is better than cure
an ounce of prevention is better than a pound of cure
it is better to stop sth bad from happening rather than try to deal with the problems after it has happened
data.chText: 预防优于补救；防患于未然是上策

ex.enText: The dentist will treat my tooth.
ex.chText: 这名牙医将治疗我的牙齿。

ex.enText: It is said that the plant can be used to treat hepatitis.
ex.chText: 据说那种植物可用来治肝炎。

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指用药物、手术等治疗疾病或创伤。

ex.enText: There is no way to cure this disease.
ex.chText: 现在没有办法治愈这种疾病。

ex.enText: The doctor failed to cure his cough.
The patient had some acupuncture treatment which seems to have cured him.
ex.chText: 患者接受了一些针刺疗法，似乎把他的病给治好了。

synonyms.bx: 指治愈疾病或病人，强调结果。

ex.enText: This plant will help to heal the wound.
ex.chText: 这种植物有助于伤口愈合。

ex.enText: As they heal, the bones will fuse together.
ex.chText: 骨头愈合时将会连接在一起。

synonyms.bx: 指（使）伤口、折断的骨头等愈合，又作 heal up。

example.ex: An operation finally cured his shin injury...
example.tran: 手术最终治好了他胫部的伤。

example.ex: Her cancer can only be controlled, not cured.
example.tran: 她的癌症只能控制，无法治愈。

value.def: If doctors or medical treatments cure an illness or injury, they cause it to end or disappear.

example.ex: MDT is an effective treatment and could cure all the leprosy sufferers worldwide...
example.tran: 联合化疗是一种有望治愈全世界所有麻风病患者的有效治疗方法。
几乎是一夜间我就被治好了。

example.ex: Now doctors believe they have cured him of the disease.
example.tran: 现在医生们确信已经治好了他的病。

value.def: If doctors or medical treatments cure a person, they make the person well again after an illness or injury.
value.tran: 治好，治愈(病人);使恢复健康

example.ex: There is still no cure for a cold...
example.tran: 尚没有治疗感冒的特效药。

example.ex: Atkinson has been told rest is the only cure for his ankle injury.
example.tran: 阿特金森被告知休息是唯一能治好他脚踝伤的办法。

value.def: A cure for an illness is a medicine or other treatment that cures the illness.

example.ex: Private firms are willing to make large scale investments to help cure Russia's economic troubles...
example.tran: 私有企业愿意投巨资帮助俄罗斯渡过经济难关。

example.ex: We need to cure our environmental problems.
example.tran: 我们需要解决环境问题。

value.def: If someone or something cures a problem, they bring it to an end.

example.ex: Punishment can never be an effective cure for acute social problems...
example.tran: 惩罚绝不是解决严重社会问题的有效办法。

example.ex: The magic cure for inflation does not exist.
example.tran: 抑制通货膨胀没有什么灵丹妙药。

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft N <l>for</l> n

value.def: A cure for a problem is something that will bring it to an end.

example.ex: The experience was a detestable ordeal, and it cured him of any ambitions to direct again...
example.tran: 那次经历是一次令人厌恶的煎熬，使得他放弃了任何再当导演的想法。

example.ex: He went to a clinic to cure his drinking and overeating.
example.tran: 他去诊所戒酒并控制饮食。

value.def: If an action or event cures someone of a habit or an attitude, it makes them stop having it.
value.tran: 矫正，使放弃(习惯或态度)

example.ex: Legs of pork were cured and smoked over the fire.

value.def: When food, tobacco, or animal skin is cured, it is dried, smoked, or salted so that it will last for a long time.
value.tran: (用干燥、熏、腌等方法)加工贮藏

trans: 治疗乐队；治愈；真情世界；怪人乐队；治疗
心理心里有个谜；心理心裏有个谜
固化时间；硫化时间；熟化时间
柠檬水；柠檬天使；春日野丽
治愈率；痊愈率；硫化速度
固化时间；硫化时间；熟化时间
